title: Year-to-year percentage of change in holiday retail sales in the U.S. 2000 to 2019
summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes Percentage change in retail sales. In total the number of data points it has is 20.
In general Percentage change in retail sales has rose over the Year.
Percentage change in retail sales is roughly constant from 2000 to 2009, gradually increasing from 2009 to 2010, and finally roughly constant from 2010 to 2019.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2009 and 2010.
The highest Percentage change in retail sales, of value 6.8 was reached at Year 2004
The lowest Percentage change in retail sales, of value 0.2 was reported at Year 2009

The line rapidly increased by 142.86% from Year 2002 to 2003,remained stable by 74.07% from Year 2007 to 2008,remained stable by 95.74% from Year 2008 to 2009,increased by 2500.0% from Year 2009 to 2010,remained stable by 75.86% from Year 2013 to 2014, and lastly, remained stable by 90.48% from Year 2018 to 2019.
